li.label: <color=#3DC616>Bean Threading Novice</color>
li.description: I've spend years training amongst the bean threaders, and yet even now I feel as if I have only scratched the surface.

li.label: <color=#FF9600>Bean Threading Journeyman</color>
li.description: The master gives me the beans, and I thread them. I think I've finally started to get the hang of it, and it's only been 10 years!

li.label: <color=#FA64D2>Bean Threading Veteran</color>
li.description: I graduated top of my class from the bean threading school, after 12 years of training. I've been working on my own for a few years since then, so I'm considered a bit of a veteran. And yet... the true masters can do such wonders!

li.label: <color=#FFDD43>Bean Threading Master</color>
li.description: To a true master, bean threading is more than a job. More than an art, even. It's a way of communing with the fundamental forces of the universe, a path to enlightenment. That is what separates the master bean threader from the rest.
